docs.snippet: Many foreign exchange experts have contended for months that sterling could not remain inconvertible if the Dutch and the West Germans freed their currencies. These observers now believe an action last week by the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxemburg...
docs.lead_paragraph: Many foreign exchange experts have contended for months that sterling could not remain inconvertible if the Dutch and the West Germans freed their currencies. These observers now believe an action last week by the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxemburg may bring early developments elsewhere -- such as a move by West Germany, which has been willing to close out the European Payments Union in the interests of convertibility.
docs.abstract: Pan-Israel Oil and Mediterranean Petroleum to begin deep drilling soon

headline.main: FINANCIAL AND BUSINESS SIDELIGHTS OF THE DAY

docs.snippet: THE HAGUE, the Netherlands, July 13 -- The International Court of Justice ruled today that indemnities awarded to dismissed United Nations employes could not be refused by the General Assembly. The vote was 9 to 3.
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HAGUE, the Netherlands, July 13 -- The International Court of Justice ruled today that indemnities awarded to dismissed United Nations employes could not be refused by the General Assembly. The vote was 9 to 3.
docs.abstract: Internatl Ct rules, 9-3, that indemnities awarded to ousted employes cannot be refused by Assembly; upholds awards to 11 ousted US natls; Assembly to act in fall; State Dept silent; Sens Welker, Ferguson comment

headline.main: World Court Backs Ousted U. N. Aides; World Court Upholds Pay Award To 11 Americans Ousted by U. N.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: An erratic movement in the Canadian dollar in the closing session of the week, was the only incident of otherwise quiet trading in the foreign exchanges. British sterling and the Continental Europeans were firm on light dealings.
docs.lead_paragraph: An erratic movement in the Canadian dollar in the closing session of the week, was the only incident of otherwise quiet trading in the foreign exchanges. British sterling and the Continental Europeans were firm on light dealings.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended July 16, 1954

docs.snippet: Two appointments to West Coast positions were announced yesterday by Emmet J. McCormack, chairman of the board of the Moore-McCormack Lines.
docs.lead_paragraph: Two appointments to West Coast positions were announced yesterday by Emmet J. McCormack, chairman of the board of the Moore-McCormack Lines.

docs.snippet: FORT WAYNE, Ind., July 23 (AP) -- Fay Crocker was six under women's par today as she won the qualifying medal in the $3,500 Fort Wayne women's open golf tournament with a 34, 35 -- 69.
docs.lead_paragraph: FORT WAYNE, Ind., July 23 (AP) -- Fay Crocker was six under women's par today as she won the qualifying medal in the $3,500 Fort Wayne women's open golf tournament with a 34, 35 -- 69.

headline.main: FAY CROCKER WINS MEDAL BY STROKE; Montevideo Player Cards 69 in Fort Wayne Tourney -- Carol Bowman Second

docs.snippet: FORT WAYNE, Ind., July 24 (AP) -- Marilynn Smith, a rabbit's foot bobbing from her belt, collected three straight birdies and a 7-under-par 68 today to gain the lead in the Fort Wayne women's open golf tournament with a 141 total.
docs.lead_paragraph: FORT WAYNE, Ind., July 24 (AP) -- Marilynn Smith, a rabbit's foot bobbing from her belt, collected three straight birdies and a 7-under-par 68 today to gain the lead in the Fort Wayne women's open golf tournament with a 141 total.

headline.main: Marilynn Smith Is Fort Wayne Leader; KANSAN, WITH 141, 2 STROKES AHEAD

docs.snippet: FORT WAYNE, Ind., July 25 (AP) -- Marilynn Smith of Wichita, Kan., matched par 75 to win the $700 first prize in the Fort Wayne women's open golf tournament with a 216 total today.

headline.main: FT. WAYNE OPEN WON BY MARILYNN SMITH

docs.snippet: GUATEMALA, July 30 -- The ruling junta that succeeded the deposed leftist regime of Jacobo Ardenz Guzman was formally presented to the diplomatic corps today at a ceremony in the National Palace.
docs.lead_paragraph: GUATEMALA, July 30 -- The ruling junta that succeeded the deposed leftist regime of Jacobo Ardenz Guzman was formally presented to the diplomatic corps today at a ceremony in the National Palace.
docs.abstract: Col Castillo Armas says Guatemala adopts anti-Communist resolution passed at Caracas Inter-Amer Conf, revokes declarations made at that time and wants to rejoin Central Amer States Orgn

headline.main: CASTILLO ADHERES TO ANTI-RED DRIVE; Guatemalan Junta Chief Tells Foreign Diplomats He Will Follow Caracas Doctrine
